trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager support for Load Balancer Preview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager support for Load Balancer Preview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.target: Using powershell for Load Balancer with Azure Resource Manager (ARM) in preview.

trans-unit.source: Using templates for load balancer
trans-unit.target: Using templates for load balancer

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager Support for Load Balancer
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Support for Load Balancer

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) is the new management framework for services in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) is the new management framework for services in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Azure Load Balancer can now be managed using Azure Resource Manager-based APIs and tools.
trans-unit.target: Azure Load Balancer can now be managed using Azure Resource Manager-based APIs and tools.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager, see [Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources](../azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure Resource Manager, see [Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources](../azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups.md).

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: With ARM, Azure Load Balancer contains the following child resources:
trans-unit.target: With ARM, Azure Load Balancer contains the following child resources:

trans-unit.source: Front end IP configuration – a Load balancer can include one or more front end IP addresses, otherwise known as a virtual IPs (VIPs).
trans-unit.target: Front end IP configuration – a Load balancer can include one or more front end IP addresses, otherwise known as a virtual IPs (VIPs).

trans-unit.source: These IP addresses serve as ingress for the traffic.
trans-unit.target: These IP addresses serve as ingress for the traffic.

trans-unit.source: Backend address pool – these are IP addresses associated with the virtual machine Network Interface Card (NIC) to which load will be distributed.
trans-unit.target: Backend address pool – these are IP addresses associated with the virtual machine Network Interface Card (NIC) to which load will be distributed.

trans-unit.source: Load balancing rules – a rule property maps a given front end IP and port combination to a set of back end IP addresses and port combination.
trans-unit.target: Load balancing rules – a rule property maps a given front end IP and port combination to a set of back end IP addresses and port combination.

trans-unit.source: With a single definition of a load balancer resource, you can define multiple load balancing rules, each rule reflecting a combination of a front end IP and port and back end IP and port associated with VMs.
trans-unit.target: With a single definition of a load balancer resource, you can define multiple load balancing rules, each rule reflecting a combination of a front end IP and port and back end IP and port associated with VMs.

trans-unit.source: Probes – probes enable you to keep track of the health of VM instances.
trans-unit.target: Probes – probes enable you to keep track of the health of VM instances.

trans-unit.source: If a health probe fails, the VM instance will be taken out of rotation automatically.
trans-unit.target: If a health probe fails, the VM instance will be taken out of rotation automatically.

trans-unit.source: Inbound NAT rules – NAT rules defining the inbound traffic flowing through the front end IP and distributed to the back end IP.
trans-unit.target: Inbound NAT rules – NAT rules defining the inbound traffic flowing through the front end IP and distributed to the back end IP.

trans-unit.source: Quickstart templates
trans-unit.target: Quickstart templates

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager allows you to provision your applications using a declarative template.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager allows you to provision your applications using a declarative template.

trans-unit.source: In a single template, you can deploy multiple services along with their dependencies.
trans-unit.target: In a single template, you can deploy multiple services along with their dependencies.

trans-unit.source: You use the same template to repeatedly deploy your application during every stage of the application lifecycle
trans-unit.target: You use the same template to repeatedly deploy your application during every stage of the application lifecycle

trans-unit.source: Templates include Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, Availability Sets, Network Interfaces (NICs), Storage Accounts, Load Balancers, Network Security Groups, and Public IPs.
trans-unit.target: Templates include Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, Availability Sets, Network Interfaces (NICs), Storage Accounts, Load Balancers, Network Security Groups, and Public IPs.

trans-unit.source: With templates you can create everything you need for a complex application using a simple file that you can check-in and collaborate on.
trans-unit.target: With templates you can create everything you need for a complex application using a simple file that you can check-in and collaborate on.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about templates
trans-unit.target: Learn more about templates

trans-unit.source: Learn more about Network Resources
trans-unit.target: Learn more about Network Resources

trans-unit.source: Templates using Azure Load Balancer can be found in a [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates) hosting a set of community generated templates
trans-unit.target: Templates using Azure Load Balancer can be found in a [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates) hosting a set of community generated templates
